thread.title: Cyber Security Stocks Surged on the Back of the Big NYSE Trading Halt
thread.title_full: Cyber Security Stocks Surged on the Back of the Big NYSE Trading Halt - Bloomberg Business

author: Julie Verhage
title: Cyber Security Stocks Surged on the Back of the Big NYSE Trading Halt
text:
The New York Stock Exchange halted trading in all securities around 11:32 a.m. in New York, citing a computer malfunction. Stocks continued to change hands on other venues such as the Nasdaq Stock Market and Bats Global Markets.
A number of cyber security stocks moved sharply higher on the news, though the NYSE has since said that the outage was due to an "internal technical issue."
https://twitter.com/LesliePicker/status/618813988978225152
One was Cyberark Software , which provides services meant to protect organizations from cyber attacks.
Imperva provides data security and other services for a number of industries such as energy, financials and the government.
AVG Technologies is an antivirus and internet security firm that operates worldwide.
Lastly, there is Palo Alto Networks , a security solutions firm that provides firewalls that help prevent data leaks and other threats.
 Finally there is the ISE Cyber Security index , which acts as a benchmark for a bunch of cyber security-related firms.
